Package t10.novel.odometry

Class NovelOdometry

java.lang.Object
t10.novel.odometry.NovelOdometry
public class NovelOdometry extends Object
Odometry localization interface.

  • Constructor Details

    • NovelOdometry

      public NovelOdometry(OdometryCoefficientSet coefficients, NovelEncoder rightEncoder, NovelEncoder leftEncoder, NovelEncoder perpendicularEncoder, double lateralWheelDistance, double perpendicularWheelOffset)
      Creates a NovelOdometry instance. See diagram: here (archived) or here.
      Parameters:
      coefficients - The coefficients to use for the odometers. Chances are this is OdometryCoefficientSet.DEFAULT.
      rightEncoder - The right side encoder.
      leftEncoder - The left side encoder.
      perpendicularEncoder - The perpendicular encoder.
      lateralWheelDistance - The distance between the lateral wheels.
      perpendicularWheelOffset - The offset of the perpendicular wheel from the center of the robot chassis.

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update()
      Updates the underlying state of this odometry localizer. Calling this method more regularly increases accuracy of the calculations, but obviously it is impossible to call this method infinitely fast, so calculations will contain some error.

      Adapted from gm0.

    • getRelativePose

      public Pose getRelativePose()
      Returns:
      The current relative pose of the robot based on the odometers.

    • setRelativePose

      public void setRelativePose(Pose pose)
      Sets the relative pose to a new pose. Helps to combat error as a result of update() not being called infinitely fast.
      Parameters:
      pose - New relative pose to base odometry calculations off of.
